thread.title: How an Amputee Excels on the Slopes

author: Jen Murphy
title: How an Amputee Excels on the Slopes
text:
When Pam Eberly’s teenage children started snowboarding in 1992, she wasn’t willing to sit in the ski lodge and let them have all the fun.
That was despite the fact that she is a transtibial amputee. Ms. Eberly lost her right leg below the knee at age 18, because of a car accident that left half her body from the waist down with third-degree burns.
Twenty-five...
